author: andschwa
body:
Introduced in #719 at 78defa739d8729b211844d21c9e18730aa2f0648, since the value for key `System.Console` is now `mscorlib` instead of `System.Console` in `CorePsTypeCatalog.cs`, tab completion of the assembly's types is broken.

``` powershell
$ [System.Console]::<tab>
```

Expect: `TreatControlCAsInput` etc.
Actual: just `WriteLine`

What's more, the types became inaccessible.

Expected:

``` powershell
$ [System.Console]::TreatControlCAsInput
False
```

Actual: nothing, nada, blank.

The `CorePsTypeCatalog.cs` relevant diff:

```
-            typeCatalog["System.Console"] = "System.Console, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a";
+            typeCatalog["System.Console"] = "mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=7cec85d7bea7798e";
```

/cc @daxian-dbw @Francisco-Gamino @mirichmo

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
I think this may stem from the fact that I feed it the runtime assemblies, instead of the reference assemblies, as I can't get a straight folder of the runtime assemblies.

That in mind, I think I know the fix. I'll have to write some code to parse the `project.lock.json` and get the paths to all the reference assemblies, and feeds those the generator. That should fix it!

comments.author: Francisco-Gamino
comments.body:
That sounds reasonable. Give it a try!

title: Fix type catalog
